Accounts.excerpt: Enables you to perform Active Directory account-related activities

AD Computer Last Logged In Date.excerpt: Retrieves the last date in which a selected machine logged in to the Active Directory

AD Copy User.excerpt: Copies an Active Directory user account and sets its properties

AD Create Account.excerpt: Creates a new account in the Active Directory

AD Delete Account.excerpt: Deletes a user account from the Active Directory

AD Disable Account.excerpt: Disables an account in the Active Directory

AD Enable Account.excerpt: Enables a disabled account in the Active Directory

AD Get Property.excerpt: Queries the Active Directory for a specific property value in a selected user/ computer account

AD Is Account Disabled.excerpt: Checks whether a specific account in the Active Directory is disabled

AD Is Account Locked.excerpt: Checks whether a specific account in the Active Directory is locked

AD Move Account.excerpt: Moves the selected user account from one OU to another

AD Rename Account.excerpt: Renames a selected account in the Active Directory

AD Search Account.excerpt: Searches for a specific account's location in the Active Directory's hierarchy

AD Search User Logon Name.excerpt: Searches for users’ logon names according to predefined criteria

AD Set Property.excerpt: Changes a user/computer account's attribute, including creating custom properties

AD Unlock Account.excerpt: Unlocks a selected account in the Active Directory

AD User Exists.excerpt: Checks whether a specific user account exists in the Active Directory

AD User Last Logged In Date.excerpt: Retrieves the last date on which a specific user logged in to the Active Directory

Active Directory Overview.excerpt: :::note Active Directory Activities allow you to manage your Active Directory accounts (e. g

Groups.excerpt: Enables you to perform Active Directory group-related activities

AD Add to Group.excerpt: Adds a user or a device to a group in the Active Directory

AD Create Group.excerpt: Creates a new group in the Active Directory

AD Delete Group.excerpt: Deletes a group from the Active Directory

AD Group Exists.excerpt: Checks whether a specific group exists in the Active Directory

AD List Group.excerpt: Lists the content of a specific group in the Active Directory – users, other groups and OUs

AD List User Groups.excerpt: Lists the groups of which the selected user is a member

AD Remove From Group.excerpt: Removes a user or computer account from the selected group

Password Management.excerpt: Enables you to manage password-related activities in Active Directory

AD Password Expiration Days Left.excerpt: Retrieves the number of days left until a user's password expires

AD LDAP Query.excerpt: Queries the Active Directory using an LDAP Query

AD List OU.excerpt: Lists the content of a specific organizational unit in the Active Directory – users, computers, other OUs, and groups

AD Users Synchronization.excerpt: Synchronizes A users/groups and their data with the Actions user list

Amazon EC2 Overview.excerpt: The activities in this category enable launching AWS virtual servers, configuring security and networking, and managing storage

Images.excerpt: Activities related to management of Amazon EC2 images

AWS Copy Image.excerpt: Copies an Amazon Web Service image from a specified region

AWS Create Image.excerpt: Create a new Amazon Web Service image based on an existing instance

AWS Deregister Image.excerpt: Deregisters an existing Amazon Web Service image

Instances.excerpt: Instances are virtual servers in Amazon's EC2 for running applications on the AWS infrastructure

AWS Launch Instance.excerpt: Launches a new Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Reboot Instance.excerpt: Reboots an Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Start Instance.excerpt: Starts an Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Stop Instance.excerpt: Stops a running Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Terminate Instance.excerpt: Terminates an Amazon Web Service instance

Network Interface.excerpt: Attaches or detaches a network interface to an Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Attach Network Interface.excerpt: Attaches a network interface to an Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Detach Network Interface.excerpt: Detaches a network interface from an Amazon Web Service instance

Snapshots.excerpt: Snapshots are incremental backups, for which only the blocks on the device that have changed after your most recent snapshot are saved

AWS Copy Snapshot.excerpt: Copies an Amazon Web Service snapshot of the same region or another one

AWS Create Snapshot.excerpt: Creates a new Amazon Web Service snapshot based on an existing volume

AWS Delete Snapshot.excerpt: Deletes an existing Amazon Web Service snapshot

Introduction to Volumes.excerpt: AWS volumes are block-level storage devices that you can attach to a single EC2 instance

AWS Attach Volume.excerpt: Attaches an existing volume to an Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Create Volume.excerpt: Creates a new Amazon Web Service volume

AWS Delete Volume.excerpt: Deletes an existing Amazon Web Service volume from an instance

AWS Detach Volume.excerpt: Detaches a volume from an Amazon Web Service instance

AWS Execute CLI.excerpt: Executes a command line on Amazon EC2 objects, using the Amazon Web Service's CLI

AWS Get Object.excerpt: Retrieves a list of objects of the selected type according to the specified criteria. Only objects from the connected region are retrieved

Azure Overview.excerpt: Azure activities integrate with your Azure AD portal

Azure AD Users Synchronization.excerpt: Synchronizes Azure AD users/groups and their data with the VAR::PRODUCTFULL recipients list

Data Mapping Overview.excerpt: Data mapping allows you to parse and map JSON-formatted data to multiple variables based on a provided schema

Development Overview.excerpt: Development activities are used to compile and run different code fragments

Attachment List.excerpt: Lists the files attached to the email that triggered the workflow (saved to C:\Program Files\Resolve\Actions Express Server\Files)

Copy File.excerpt: Copies a specified file from a source location to a destination location

Delete File.excerpt: Deletes a file in a specified location

Download Email Attachment.excerpt: Downloads an attachment that was received by email and saves it at the selected server location

File Accessed Date.excerpt: Returns the date on which the file was last accessed

File Checksum Comparison.excerpt: Compares two files and determines whether they are identical or not

File Count.excerpt: Counts the number of files in a folder

File Exists.excerpt: Checks whether a specified file exists or not

File Writable.excerpt: Checks whether a specific file is writable or not

Files and Folders Overview.excerpt: Files and Folders activities are used to create, change, delete or extract data from files and folders

Copy Folder.excerpt: Copies the contents of a specified folder from a source location to a destination location

Delete Folder.excerpt: Deletes a folder (and all the files and subfolders that reside in it) in a specified location

Get Folder Size.excerpt: Returns the size of a specified folder

Get Volume List.excerpt: Returns the volume list of a specified machine

List Folder.excerpt: Lists all files and folders under a specified folder, according to predefined time criteria

Continuous File Reading.excerpt: Returns the data that was added to a specified text file, since it was last read

Read CSV.excerpt: Reads a CSV file and returns all data in it

Read Excel.excerpt: Reads an Excel file and returns all data in it

Read File.excerpt: Reads a text file and returns a one-column table of the file's content

Read PDF.excerpt: Reads a PDF file and returns its content

Write CSV.excerpt: Produces a CSV file out of a table

Write Excel.excerpt: Produces an Excel file out of a table

Write File.excerpt: Creates a new plain text file

HPOM Acknowledge Alert.excerpt: Acknowledges an existing open alert in HPOM

HyperV Overview.excerpt: HyperV activities help you to manage your HyperV virtual environment

QRadar Add Offense Note.excerpt: Adds a note to an existing offense

Change Severity.excerpt: Changes the severity level of an incident

Clear Displayed Incident.excerpt: Removes an incident from the Resolve Actions Dashboard (used after the Assign Incident activity)

Close Incident.excerpt: Closes an incident (the activity does not terminate the workflow)

Delete Incident.excerpt: Deletes an incident from the Resolve Actions Dev database

Display Incident.excerpt: Adds an incident to the Resolve Actions Dev Dashboard

New Event.excerpt: Simulates an external event generation sent to Resolve Actions. The simulated event goes through the mapping and trigger action cycle

New Incident.excerpt: Creates an incident and sends it to be evaluated by the rule base engine

Remove User Assignment.excerpt: Removes an assigned user from the incident that triggered the workflow

Reset Incident.excerpt: Resets an incident that triggered the workflow, or any other incident (typically used in cases of false alerts)

Set Incident Ticket ID.excerpt: Assigns an incident with a Ticket ID, which can be used by another workflow

Update Incident Event.excerpt: Updates the Incident with new information

User Assignment.excerpt: Assigns a user to handle the incident that activated the workflow

Incidents Overview.excerpt: Incidents activities are used to manage VAR::PRODUCTFULL incidents

Get Incident Occurrences.excerpt: Returns the number of incidents that occurred over the last specified period

Get Incident Open Duration.excerpt: Returns the open duration of an Incident (in minutes)

Get Incident Severity.excerpt: Returns the severity of a selected incident or its currently active instance

Get Incident Ticket ID.excerpt: Returns a specific incident's ticket ID (used to retrieve ticket numbers generated by an integration)

Get Number of Incident Instances.excerpt: Returns a specific incident's number of concurrent instances

Get Open Incidents.excerpt: Returns the list of the currently open incidents in Resolve Actions, according to predefined criteria

Incident Counter.excerpt: Returns the number of currently open incidents, according to the selected criteria and time duration

Incident History Report.excerpt: Creates a log containing the incident history according to a specified filter

JSON Overview.excerpt: JSON activities are used to manage JSON sessions

List of Activities Overview.excerpt: The following is a list of all VAR::PRODUCTFULL built-in activities

metadata.description: The following is a list of all Resolve Actions built-in activities.

Abs.excerpt: Returns the absolute value of a specified number

Ceiling.excerpt: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to a specified number

Floor.excerpt: Returns the greatest integer that is less than or equal to the specified number

Max.excerpt: Returns the higher of two numbers

Min.excerpt: Returns the lower of two numbers

Power.excerpt: Returns a specified number raised to the specified power

Round.excerpt: Rounds a decimal value to the nearest integral value

Sign.excerpt: Returns a value indicating the sign of a decimal number

Square.excerpt: Returns the square root of a specified number

Truncate.excerpt: Calculates the integral part of a specified decimal number

Math Overview.excerpt: Math functions allow you to perform different types of calculations on a given numeric result or a constant number

Counter.excerpt: Increases the value of a counter (represented by the activity instance name) by 1

Function Calculator.excerpt: Runs VB script syntax functions. The Function Calculator performs various calculations on variables

Random Number Generator.excerpt: Generates a random number within a specified range

Guide - Using the Teams Bot.excerpt: This guide is an overview of how you can use Microsoft Teams to interact with automation directly within the Resolve Actions platform

XCH Add Distribution Group Member.excerpt: Adds a user to an MS Exchange distribution group

XCH Get Mailbox Statistics.excerpt: Retrieves a mailbox's statistics data; e. g

Ping Latency.excerpt: Retrieves the elapsed time passing between sending a ping command and retrieving an answer

Processes Overview.excerpt: Processes activities are used to retrieve information related to the operating system's processes, and perform actions related to them

SNMP Overview.excerpt: SNMP Activities allow you to manage SNMP traps (e. g

Single SSH Command.excerpt: Sends a single SSH protocol command

Salesforce Overview.excerpt: Salesforce activities are used to integrate with your organization's Salesforce and allow to create records, execute SOQL, get records, and update rec

Self Service Overview.excerpt: Self Service activities send a response to users who have launched the Self Service form, or to another workflow that ran in order to populate a list

Services Overview.excerpt: Services Activities allow to manage the installed services on a device with which the Workflow interacts: get the list of services, start, stop, pause

Cell.excerpt: Take actions on specific cells in a table

Get Cell Value.excerpt: Retrieves a cell's value from a table

Set Cell Value.excerpt: Sets a new value to a cell in a table

Sum Cells.excerpt: Sums up a sequence of table cell values. Text characters are ignored

Column.excerpt: Take action on specific columns in a table

Delete Column from Memory Table.excerpt: Deletes columns from a table based on their index

Get Columns Count.excerpt: Counts the number of columns in a table

Rename Memory Table Column.excerpt: Renames a selected column in a table

Row.excerpt: Take action on specific rows in a table

Add Row to Memory Table.excerpt: Adds a new row (or several rows) to a table

Delete Row from Memory Table.excerpt: Deletes rows from a table, according to their index

Get Rows Count.excerpt: Counts the number of rows in a table

Get Rows.excerpt: Returns rows from a table, according to predefined criteria

Search Row by Interval.excerpt: Searches for a row containing certain keywords within a range of rows, and returns the matching row's index and text

Table.excerpt: Table Activities are used to convert XML or XML elements to a table, or a table to XML

Convert to HTML Table.excerpt: Converts a table variable into an HTML table and stores it in a variable named after the activity

Convert to Plain Text.excerpt: Converts a table variable into plain text and stores it in a different variable

Create Memory Table.excerpt: Creates a ResultSet table and saves it to the memory

Memory Table Comparison.excerpt: Compares two tables (or two specific columns in the tables), and displays the equivalent/nonequivalent rows

Memory Table Union.excerpt: Merges two identical schema tables into one. The two tables must have the same number of columns

Replace Values in Table.excerpt: Returns a new table with updated values based on key pair mappings defined in a table of global variables

Result Set Filter.excerpt: Filters a table according to a statement and returns the filtered table

Sort Table.excerpt: Sorts a selected table according to the selected column name or column number (the Activity can be used, for example, to get the oldest/newest file or

Tables Overview.excerpt: Table activities allow you to create tables, access them and modify them according to your needs

Telnet Sessions Overview.excerpt: The Virtual Terminal Protocol (TELNET) provides connections to remote hosts

Query.excerpt: Query activities allow you to analyze and extract information about a piece of text

Contains.excerpt: Checks if a phrase exists within a text

Extract by Pattern.excerpt: Extracts all rows within a pattern

Extract Line from Text.excerpt: Extracts a line from a text, according to its location or a matching keyword

Get Length.excerpt: Returns the number of characters in a text

Index Of.excerpt: Returns the location of a phrase within a text

InStr Reverse.excerpt: Returns the position of the first occurrence of a phrase within a text (or 0 if it does not exist)

InStr.excerpt: Returns the position of the first occurrence of a phrase within a text (or 0 if it does not exist)

Is Alert in HTML Format.excerpt: Checks whether or not the email that triggered the workflow is HTML-formatted

Is Empty.excerpt: Checks if a variable's value is empty

Is Numeric.excerpt: Checks if a text or variable's value contains a valid numeric value

Left.excerpt: Extracts characters from the left side of a text

Match Regular Expression.excerpt: Returns all matches between a Regular Expression and a given text

Right.excerpt: Extracts characters from the right side of a text

Split.excerpt: Splits a text into phrases (according to a delimiter) and returns a one-dimensional table containing the phrases

Sub String by Text.excerpt: Returns a table or text value of the searched text between a starting and ending point

Sub String.excerpt: Extracts a phrase from a text according to its index and number of characters

Text Overview.excerpt: Text activities allow you to perform different types of manipulations on a given piece of text (e. g

Update.excerpt: Update activities allow you to modify a piece of text

Convert Text To Table.excerpt: Converts a text variable into a table according to column/row delimiters, and returns the table

Left Trim.excerpt: Removes the leading blank spaces from a text

Lower Case.excerpt: Switches all characters in a text to lowercase

Replace Paragraph.excerpt: Replaces one paragraph with other text

Replace String Advanced.excerpt: Returns a new text in which all occurrences of a specified phrase are replaced with another phrase

Replace String.excerpt: Replaces all occurrences of a phrase with another

Right Trim.excerpt: Removes the trailing blank spaces from a text

Trim by String.excerpt: Removes characters from the beginning or end of a text

Trim.excerpt: Removes both leading and trailing blank spaces from a text

Upper Case.excerpt: Capitalizes all characters in a text

Time Controls Overview.excerpt: Time Control activities enable you to apply timing conditions as well as work with date and time variables

Add Date.excerpt: Adds an interval to a given date

Conditional Wait.excerpt: Puts the workflow on hold until a specified condition applies

Date Difference.excerpt: Calculates the difference (in a selected time volume) between two time stamps

Format Date.excerpt: Converts a date to a specified target format

Get Date.excerpt: Returns current, future, or past time in the selected format, in a specific time zone (can be used, for example, to get the exact time 10 minutes ago

Wait for Command Line.excerpt: Pauses the workflow until a Resolve Actions CMD message that complies with a specific condition is received

Wait for Email.excerpt: Pauses the workflow until an email is received

Wait for Input.excerpt: Pauses the workflow until a recipient's input that complies with a specified condition is received

Wait for SMS.excerpt: Pauses the workflow until an SMS that complies with a specific condition is received

Wait.excerpt: Pauses the workflow for a specified period of time

VM Current Snapshot.excerpt: Retrieves the name of the Virtual Machine's current snapshot

VM Delete All Snapshots.excerpt: Deletes all snapshots of a Virtual Machine

VM List Snapshot.excerpt: Lists all snapshots of a Virtual Machine

VM Rename Snapshot.excerpt: Renames a snapshot of a Virtual Machine

VM Revert to Current Snapshot.excerpt: Reverts to the current snapshot of a Virtual Machine

VM Revert to Snapshot.excerpt: Reverts to a snapshot of a Virtual Machine

VM Snapshot Info.excerpt: Retrieves the information of a Virtual Machine's selected snapshot

VMware Snapshots Overview.excerpt: VMware Snapshots are states of a Virtual Machine taken at a given moment. VMware Snapshot activities help you manage these Snapshots

VM List Templates.excerpt: Lists the templates in the vCenter

VM Mark Template.excerpt: Converts a Virtual Machine to a template

VM Unmark Template.excerpt: Converts a template to a Virtual Machine

Virus Total Overview.excerpt: All of the activities provide you with three different options for submitting a package for inspection through VirusTotal – the file itself, the file

Hash Check.excerpt: Returns a table that contains the last scan date, the number of scanners, and the number of scanners that found this hash malicious

Submit File.excerpt: Returns a table that contains the last scan date, the number of scanners, and the number of scanners that found this file malicious

URL Check.excerpt: Checks the availability of a URL based on a return code or an existence of a specific phrase

Application Pools.excerpt: Application pools are used to separate sets of IIS worker processes that share the same configuration and application boundaries

Application Pool List.excerpt: Retrieves a list of application pools on a selected machine

Application Pool Recycle.excerpt: Restarts the specified application pool on the designated server

Application Pool Start.excerpt: Starts the specified application pool on the designated server

Application Pool Status.excerpt: Returns the specified application pool's status

Application Pool Stop.excerpt: Stops the specified application pool on the designated server

HTTP.excerpt: HTTP Activities related to requests and checks for URLs or HTTP requests, header values, or file downloads

File Download.excerpt: Downloads a file from a website

Get Header Value.excerpt: Gets the value of the specified header

IIS.excerpt: Internet Information Services (IIS) is a flexible, general-purpose web server from Microsoft that runs on Windows systems to serve requested HTML page

Virtual Directories.excerpt: A virtual directory is a directory name (also referred to as path) that you specify in Internet Information Services (IIS) and map to a physical direc

Create Virtual Directory.excerpt: Creates a Virtual Directory on an IIS website

Edit Virtual Directory.excerpt: Edits a Virtual Directory on an IIS website

Web Overview.excerpt: Web activities are used to invoke or stop web-related methods

Data.excerpt: Windows Data activities query the specified host to get information about that host such as available disk space, installed software, system uptime, a

Get CPU.excerpt: Returns the current CPU value (usage/availability) of a machine. If there is more than one CPU on the target machine, a table is returned

Get Disk Space.excerpt: Returns the current disk space value (usage/availability) of a machine

Get Installed Software.excerpt: Returns a list of the installed software on a server

Get Memory.excerpt: Returns the available memory/memory usage of the selected machine (in MB)

Get Operating System.excerpt: Returns a server's operating system type

Get Windows Event Logs.excerpt: Returns a table of all events according to the specified event type

WMI Query.excerpt: Explores and queries the management classes, objects, and properties of a WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation)

Registry.excerpt: The Windows Registry is a hierarchical database that stores low-level settings for the Microsoft Windows operating system and for applications that op

Delete Registry.excerpt: Deletes a selected entry from the registry according to a selected registry key and a path

Query Registry Value.excerpt: Queries a selected entry in the registry according to a selected registry key and a path

Server.excerpt: The Server activities enable management of Windows servers

Create Windows Event Log.excerpt: Creates an entry in the selected Windows event log

Performance Monitor.excerpt: Performance counters are measurements of system state or activity. They can be part of the operating system or of an individual application

Server Hibernate.excerpt: Puts the selected workstation into Hibernation mode

Server Logoff.excerpt: Logs a user off a server

Server Standby.excerpt: Puts the selected workstation into standby mode

User Authentication.excerpt: Validates a user's access to a target machine

Windows Overview.excerpt: Windows activities are used to invoke activities that are only available in MS Windows environments

Attributes.excerpt: Attributes are part of XML elements. An element can have multiple unique attributes

Add XML Attribute.excerpt: Adds the specified attribute as the last node in the collection

Delete XML Attribute.excerpt: Removes the selected attribute from the specified Xpath

Edit XML Attribute.excerpt: Changes a specified XML attribute's value

Nodes.excerpt: The Node object is the primary data type for the entire DOM

Add XML Node.excerpt: Adds a new node in the specified Xpath

XML Delete Node by XPath.excerpt: Deletes an XML node according to its path

Sessions.excerpt: Sessions can be used in subsequent XML steps to modify the XML data. Sessions Activities can be used to start, display, and save an XML session

Save XML Session.excerpt: Saves the XML session to a file

Table to XML.excerpt: Converts a Table to an XML

XML Elements to Table.excerpt: Converts a specific table with its attributes within the specified XML to a table variable

XML to Table.excerpt: Converts a specific table within the XML to a table

XML Overview.excerpt: XML Activities are used to manage XML sessions: edit XML nodes and delete them, for example

Variables.excerpt: Variables are system parameters used to represent a dynamic value

Incident Caching.excerpt: Incident caching is an event deduplication mechanism that enables you to control the way VAR::PRODUCTFULL responds to repeating incoming events gener

Incidents.excerpt: Choose Repository > Incident Configuration and open the Incidents list. The following window is displayed:

headers: Setting Up Client Application and Client ID in Azure AD
Syncing Users and Groups into VAR::PRODUCT
Azure AD User Synchronization.excerpt: VAR::PRODUCTFULL enables the synchronization of users and groups from Azure Active Directory (AD)

metadata.description: Resolve Actions supports the synchronization of users and groups from Azure Active Directory (AD).

Introduction to Recipients.excerpt: Recipients are receivers of messages and notifications. They can be grouped into recipient groups

Managing Groups.excerpt: Choose Repository > Recipients and open the Groups list. The following window is displayed:

Managing Users.excerpt: Choose Repository > Recipients and open the Users list. The following window is displayed:

Filtering Entities.excerpt: The Filter panel allows you to easily locate entities from any window

Understanding Repository Entities.excerpt: The Repository makes use of similar looking entity panels to define a variety of parameters

Using Entity Panels.excerpt: The following example from Repository > General, is a typical entity panel:

Schedules.excerpt: Choose Repository > Schedules and Triggers and open the Schedules list. The following window is displayed:

Triggers.excerpt: Choose Repository > Schedules and Triggers and open the Triggers list. The following window is displayed:

Introduction to Workflows and Templates.excerpt: The Workflows section under Repositories provides facilities to manage both your workflows and your templates

Managing your Templates.excerpt: :::note The treatment here is very brief. Manipulating templates require familiarity with the Workflow Designer(

Workflows.excerpt: Navigate to Repository > Workflows. You will be offered the following display:

Adding Fields to a Form.excerpt: There are two ways to add fields to a Form:

Entering Form Metadata.excerpt: Start creating a Form by adding the following metadata

Generating Blocks From a Workflow.excerpt: To automatically create blocks (fields) from a Workflow:

Manually Adding Fields to a Form.excerpt: If you don't want to use the Generate Blocks feature, you can manually drag desired fields to the Form

Editing and Deleting a Folder.excerpt: Follow these instructions to delete or change the name of a folder

Enabling a Form.excerpt: You must enable a Form to make it available in the Self Service Portal(. /Home-Page/Self-Service-Portal/introduction-to-self-service-portal

Deleting a Field.excerpt: To delete a field, hover over it, and click the Trash icon

Dropdown Properties.excerpt: There are two ways to populate the drop-down list so that users can select the correct drop-down property value

Field Properties.excerpt: Each field has specific properties that can be modified to change how it looks and behaves

Field Types.excerpt: There are different types of fields and various ways to modify them to suit your needs

Moving a Field.excerpt: To move a field, click and hold its four-headed arrow icon and then drag and drop it to the new location

Text, Text Area, and Password Properties.excerpt: For Text fields, when using Generate Blocks, the label will automatically be the variable's name, which you can edit to be more friendly

Moving a Form.excerpt: It is possible to change the folder where a form resides without re-saving the Form as a new version (Save As)

Setting Permissions on a Form.excerpt: Setting permissions on a form will define who can access the Form in the Self Service portal

headers: Delete a Category and Maintain Activities

Disable.excerpt: By default, all activities in a workflow are enabled, meaning they will run during workflow execution

Paste.excerpt: The Paste action lets you quickly move or duplicate activities within the same workflow or across different workflows

Create.excerpt: Take these steps to create a new category:

Rename.excerpt: Take these steps to rename a category:

Adding Activities Using the Search Tool.excerpt: The Search tool lets you find activities by keyword. Results include both activity categories and specific activity types that match the search term

Adding from the Activities Tree.excerpt: The Activities tree, in the upper-left corner of the Workflow Designer, lists all activity categories alphabetically. Each category shows:

Adding Suggested Activities.excerpt: The Suggested Activities list displays up to six recommended activity types based on the content of your workflow

Introduction to Adding Activities.excerpt: In the Workflow Designer, activities are the building blocks used to automate tasks

Pasting Copied Activities.excerpt: The Paste option lets you insert a copy of an activity or group of activities into a workflow

Clean Memory.excerpt: Clears a variable's value from its allocated memory cell

Controls Overview.excerpt: The decision points that determine how the workflow will proceed. Examples of controls are conditions such as if/else decisions

Display Multi Value.excerpt: Displays a constant or a variable's value (table or simple text) in the audit trail

Display Value.excerpt: Displays a constant or a variable's value (table or simple text) in the audit trail

Exit While.excerpt: Use only when you want to immediately exit the loop. This activity can only be used inside a While loop

For Each.excerpt: The ForEach control lets you repeat an activity or set of activities for each row in a table

Goto.excerpt: Redirects to another activity in the workflow (according to its name) and executes it. This activity is commonly used in cases of any failure (e

If-Else.excerpt: Executes one activity branch or another, according to a different activity's value or a system variable's value (e. g

Lock Executor.excerpt: Locks an executor to be exclusively used by the activities of the running workflow in case multiple executor components are set up on the same cluster

Memory Set.excerpt: Allocates a memory cell for a variable's numeric/textual value storage

Multi Memory Set.excerpt: Allocates a value to one or more Workflow/Global variables

Parallel.excerpt: Executes two parallel activity branches or more. This activity is usually used when running two parallel workflows

Run Workflow.excerpt: Runs a child workflow within the current one

Stop Workflow.excerpt: Terminates all instances of a specified workflow

Terminate Workflow.excerpt: Terminates the entire current workflow (all running branches)

Terminate.excerpt: Terminates the current branch in the current workflow

Unlock Executor.excerpt: Unlocks a locked executor (follows a Unlock Executor Control(. /unlock-executor

While.excerpt: Runs an activity or a group of activities for a predefined number of iterations

Workflow Counter.excerpt: Returns the number of currently active instances of the selected Workflow

Define and Edit Parameters.excerpt: Click the color-coded icon in the upper-right corner of an activity on the Workflow Designer canvas to open the Details dialog

Select an Executor Module.excerpt: Executors improve workflow performance and scalability by providing load balancing among the servers

Set an Activity Timeout.excerpt: Each activity includes a timeout setting. If the activity does not complete within the defined time, it automatically aborts

Updating the Activity Instance Name.excerpt: At the top of the Details dialog, the strip displays: - The activity type on the left - The user-defined activity instance name on the right

Workflow File Options.excerpt: Tags help organize and find workflows. You can use existing tags or create new ones

Building a Favorites List.excerpt: For convenience, you can create a Favorites list in the Workflow Designer, so you can quickly access the activities and controls that you use most fre

Create a New Workflow.excerpt: Create New adds a blank workflow with Start and End elements

Export Workflow.excerpt: The Export feature lets you download a workflow in XML file format

Import Workflow.excerpt: You can import workflows saved as XM

Insert Workflow.excerpt: If the imported workflow already exists choose one of the following:

Open Template.excerpt: Templates are customizable, pre-built workflows fro common use cases

headers: Opening a Workflow from the Repository
Opening a Workflow.excerpt: To start using the Workflow Designer, open a workflow from the Welcome screen

Save Workflow.excerpt: The Workflow Designer provides two save options:

Using the List of Templates.excerpt: Templates are sample workflows that provide a foundation for building workflows for specific scenarios

Workflow Revisions.excerpt: The Workflow Designer supports version control by letting you create and manage multiple revisions of workflows and templates

Notes.excerpt: The Notes tab of the Activity Details dialog allows you to enter comments about the activity

Run Workflows.excerpt: The Execute function runs a workflow and then displays a log providing information related to the execution of each activity

Verify.excerpt: The Verify function checks a workflow for valid configuration, ensuring all components (e. g

Dashboard.excerpt: Log in to VAR::PRODUCTFULL and open the Navigation menu:

Workflow Metadata.excerpt: The Documentation dialog displays the following data about a workflow:

headers: Locating Activities Using the Search Tool
Navigation.excerpt: The Reference toolbar, in the upper-right corner of the Workflow Designer, offers tools for viewing your workflow layout and locating specific compone

Settings.excerpt: Every workflow has one or more Owners and a set of permissions associated with it. An Owner is a user who manages permissions for the workflow

Product Navigation.excerpt: Welcome to the Product Navigation section

Connection Issues.excerpt: Issue: When I run the installer, I get a message that a technical error has occurred, and I’m advised to try again

General Troubleshooting Information.excerpt: If you run into issues setting up VAR::PRODUCTFULL, first see if any of the topics in this section can help you resolve the issue yourself

metadata.description: If you run into issues during setup, first see if any of the topics in this section can help you resolve the issue yourself.
